definition: modal particle
dialect/language/speech
to tell to
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: The paper deals with the function of modal particles in modal category.
sentences.chinese: 本文討論情態語氣範疇中語氣詞的功能問題。

sentences.english: The mood particle de C-selects a CP containing a Foc.
sentences.chinese: 語氣詞的範疇選擇包含焦點標記詞的CP。

sentences.english: Modal particle is an important feature of Chinese language.
sentences.chinese: 語氣詞是漢語的一個重要特徵。

sentences.english: But le2 appearing at the end of a sentence is a modal word.
sentences.chinese: “了2”用於句末，表示語氣，是語氣詞。

sentences.english: Finally, the paper attempts to provide an interpretation of the sequences of modal particles which concurred.
sentences.chinese: 最後嘗試對語氣詞同現的位序給予解釋。

sentences.english: Chinese modal particles belong to functional auxiliary words, whose modal meanings are elusive.
sentences.chinese: 漢語語氣詞屬功能助詞，其語氣義是難以捉摸的。

sentences.english: Chinese modal particle has no equivalent part of speech in English.
sentences.chinese: 英語中沒有相當於漢語語氣詞的詞類。

sentences.english: The modal particle system of southern Fujian dialect has special features.
sentences.chinese: 閩南方言語氣詞系統很有特色。

definition: phonetic symbol
comma (punct.)
punctuation/a punctuation mark
to write characters in simplified form/the simplified form of a character/to abbreviate (a word or expression)/to write in simple language
to digress/to stray from the subject
synonym
ellipsis (punct.)
voice (grammar)
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
technical term/proper noun
(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
Zen saying repeated as cant/(fig.) catchphrase/mantra/favorite expression/stock phrase
to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
to be at a loss for words/speechless
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
